Name: Student Solutions Manual and Study Guide for Serway/Jewett's Physics for Scientists and Engineers, Volume 1

ReviewList.Text: This solutions manual is not like most where the solutions simply cover odd problems. Instead, this book has chosen "selected" problems to solve. This means that there are some odd and some even numbered problems. Apparently they are problems which the author of the book thinks best illustrate the concepts in each chapter. While the solutions are thorough, including both a conceptual discussion and the mathematical solution, they include too much information. I prefer a simple solution where I can see the bare-boned mathematics in as many examples as possible. I was disappointed to find only an unpredictable collection of solutions which used precious space in the book at the expense of other problem solutions. As I said, the solutions themselves are decent-I just wish they were all there.

I thought this solutions manual was going to be very useful ... unfortunately, it doesn't contain solutions to every problem or even to every odd problem, instead skipping over a few problems (sometimes more) at a time. It is indeed helpful for those problems it does have solutions for, which is why I rated it 3 stars, however if you need a hint to a problem with no solution, you're stuck!

I bought this only because my professor uses it but it is really lacking in answers. It isn't very productive when you have an even question for home work and your prof doesn't go over it in class. Makes you wonder whether you're right or not
I don't think that this student solutions manual is that helpful because it doesn't have all the answers for odd questions.  It only gives steps to those questions that have a square on them.
I expected every other problem to be completely worked out so I would be able to understand the problems. I was wrong it was only  select problems ex: 5, 9, 15, 21
This book only covers chapters 1-22, if I'd had known this I would likely not have purchased it and would have instead bought volume 2 since those are the problems I need.

Great solutions manual! Don't buy the textbook without this manual as well as Vol. 2 for the second half of the book (if needed). I absolutely love this solutions manual. It has saved my life time and time again. It has also saved me so much time when I couldn't figure out a practice problem, then I knew how to do similar problems. Love it!

Disappointed it doesn't have all the given answers to the immense textbook so it's almost a waste of money. Not much of a student manual if it teaches you only some of the problems and skips some steps.
